key_type.title: Authentication type
key_type.description: Select whether to authenticate with a Webhook URL (at channel level) or with a Bot token (at workspace level).

api_token.title: Slack webhook
api_token.description: Type the Slack webhook URL, which is generated by Slack as an incoming webhook. You can create or find your webhook in the Incoming Webhooks section of the [Slack API website](https://api.slack.com/incoming-webhooks). If you have been using an API key, update your configuration to use a webhook instead.

channel_name.title: Slack channel
channel_name.description: If you use a webhook, you must specify an existing Slack channel to post notifications to.

team_url.title: Slack team name
team_url.description: If you use a webhook, you must specify your team name, which is the word or phrase before _.slack.com_ in your team URL. For example, if your team URL is https://team.slack.com, the team name is _team_.

event_filter_section.title: **Automated Slack Notifications:** Customize your selection by choosing the events for which you want to receive notifications. Notifications will automatically be sent to the specified slack channel only for the selected events.

bot_token.title: Slack bot token
bot_token.description: Type the Slack bot token. You can find your bot token in the OAuth & Permissions section of the [Slack API website](https://api.slack.com/apps) after clicking on your app name. You also need to add three scopes for your bot token - chat:write, team:read, and channel:manage. See [Requesting scopes](https://api.slack.com/authentication/basics#scopes) section
